page.title: 04BLACK TORRINGTON CHURCH
page.content: The church is dedicated to St Mary. It has a tower with six bells and a clock a nave, south aisle with fine wagon vaulting, north transept and chancel. In the north transept, which may be Saxon, is a piscina dating from 1100. The church was rebuilt by the Zouch family in the 14th century. The pews were carved by Col. Woodward Scott in 1927. The pulpit is decorated with flowers and fruit. Above is a canopy and sounding board dating from 1797. The organ was built in 1791 and installed in 1902. The granite font is 14th century.The green and pink diamond shaped windows date from 1798. The patterned tiles in the baptistry are 16th century from Barnstaple. There is a plaque in memory of John Russell who bred Jack Russell terriers and died here in 1883. The church was restored and re-roofed in 1902.
